title: The King of the Crags
description: In his "utterly fascinating" (Book Smuggler) debut, The Adamantine Palace , Stephen Deas "restored [dragons] to all their scaly fire- breathing glory" ( Daily Telegraph ). Now, as the Realms teeter on the brink of war, the fate of humanity rests in the survival of one majestic white dragon.Prince Jehal has had his way-now his lover Zafir sits atop the Realms with hundreds of dragons and their riders at her beck and call. But Jehal's plots are far from over, for he isn't content to sit back and watch Zafir command the earth and sky. He wants that glory for himself- no matter who he must sacrifice to get it. The one thing Jehal fears is that the white dragon still lives-and if that is so, then blood will flow, on all sides...
author: Stephen Deas
